file_content.text: So, yeah--I sold him a few secrets. He paid better than you do, and it's not like it got you in trouble.
How long have you two been working together?
When did you start?
I don't know... first time we went to Dromund Kaas, I sent him some stuff. Just became a regular thing.
Why did you pick a side?
You fought him instead of me.
He promised he'd keep our deal quiet. If you lied to me, you'd be the one dead.
But look, you don't need to worry.
You're only digging yourself in deeper.
That doesn't make it better!
Why? What's the big deal?
I didn't talk about the missions--I'm not stupid. He was into bombing spaceports and raiding transports, not espionage and conspiracies.
I've dedicated my life to this work. Selling Imperial secrets... it can't continue.
You can't keep doing this.
Meaning what?
No real harm done, and the Wheezer won't be a threat from now on....
Well... I'll let it slide.
What say we put this behind us?
Are you serious?
If I thought you'd be that way about it, I would've offered you a cut.
We've worked together a long time, now. I knew what to expect.
I can accept who you are.
I don't suppose there's any money left?
I could use some extra cash.
Not one credit. Come on--we'll check the Wheezer's pockets, and go home.
I don't approve of what you did, Kaliyo. I just know better than to be surprised.
Don't push it.
I kind of like hearing that. Come on... let's go home.
The Empire gave you a job. It gave you protection. In return, you sold us out.
You betrayed the Empire.
What "us"? I didn't sell you out--I kept you from knowing for your sake!
You should know by now that I am never going to care about the Empire. Not like you do, not at all.
All this time, I knew what you were like--but I thought we could work together.
Then maybe this was a mistake.
Maybe I was wrong. I can't trust you anymore.
That's too bad. Because I haven't changed.
I'm not asking you to change. But we're partners; we're supposed to rely on each other.
Help us work together.
If you don't care about the Empire, care about that.
I do. I like working with you, I just--you know how it is.
I'll try. Guess we'll see how it goes.
I don't need you to care, but I can't have a traitor on my team.
You've gone too far this time!
Step out of line again and you're dead, understand?
Yeah, I understand. I'm your freaking prisoner.
Let's get out of here.
Remember, we're not here to make trouble. You start something, I get unhappy.
Kaliyo. Of all the gifts you've sent to me, this is truly the finest.
A former Imperial Intelligence agent. How marvelous.
An agent of Imperial Intelligence. How marvelous.
I don't understand what you mean.
I'm a "gift"?
Kaliyo said you needed help. We're willing to work with you.
I'm here to negotiate.
You believed her?
Wheezer.
And you're just another murderer who justifies himself with politics.
Bad move, terrorist scum.
Aren't we all?
Whoa--tone it down, both of you.
Have you not told her?
Have you not told him?
Kaliyo has been selling information to the Revolutionary Edge Brigade ever since she joined the Empire.
What are you doing?
Imperial security data, spaceport blueprints, the names of powerful people... useful things. But now she's gone beyond the call of duty.
You've been selling our secrets to anarchists?
Kaliyo, is that true?
It's not how he makes it sound. This wasn't what we agreed!
"Beyond the call of duty" how?
What are you talking about?
By delivering you, of course.
As if I didn't see that coming.
She betrayed me. No surprise.
Shut up. This wasn't what we agreed to.
Why bother keeping it private, when your associate dies anyway?
She's more useful dead than alive. Her hands and eyes can get us through biometric security scans.
He's more useful dead than alive. His hands and eyes can get us through biometric security scans.
This isn't a harvest job!
Then I apologize for misreading our agreement... but this is too promising an opportunity to pass up.
Tell me what's going on. Tell me the truth.
Talk to me, Kaliyo.
I don't want to fight you. I know Kaliyo doesn't either. We can help each other.
We can still work this out.
I do not bargain with the enemy.
Damn you, agent. And damn you, Wheezer, for making me do this.
No mercy.
I fought the Eagle in his nest. As terrorists go, you're barely worth a footnote.
You're dead, Wheezer. [Attack]
Damn it, agent!
Step away.
I'm disappointed with you, Kaliyo. You were never a believer, but siding with the Empire...?
I didn't want to pick a side.
